type.name: section
type.title: Short title.
type.context: SULPHURIC ACID ACT under Short title. 1. This Act may be cited as the Sulphuric Acid Act.
type.description: This Act may be cited as the Sulphuric Acid Act.

type.name: section
type.title: Interpretation.
type.context: SULPHURIC ACID ACT under Interpretation. 2. Landing of sulphuric acid. [26 of 1949]  13 of 1996                           Temporary storage. type.name: section
type.title: Licence to import or sell by wholesale.
type.context: SULPHURIC ACID ACT under Licence to import or sell by wholesale. 3. (1) No one shall import or sell by wholesale sulphuric acid unless he has first obtained from the Commissioner a licence in writing for that purpose.  (2) The Commissioner may at any time  (a) refuse to grant a licence under this section, or  (b) cancel a  licence  granted  by  him,  if  in  his opinion it is in the interest of the public or for the public safety so to do.

description.description: No one shall import or sell by wholesale sulphuric acid unless he has first obtained from the Commissioner a licence in writing for that purpose.
The Commissioner may at any time
refuse to grant a licence under this section, or
cancel a  licence  granted  by  him,  if  in  his opinion it is in the interest of the public or for the public safety so to do.

type.name: section
type.title: Landing of sulphuric acid.
type.context: SULPHURIC ACID ACT under Landing of sulphuric acid. 4. All sulphuric acid imported into Guyana shall be landed at an approved place of unloading:   Provided that, with the permission of the Commissioner General and   subject to any conditions he may impose, packages containing sulphuric acid may be discharged overside into boats, lighters, or other craft, for conveyance to an approved place of unloading or to a magazine.
type.description: All sulphuric acid imported into Guyana shall be landed at an approved place of unloading:   Provided that, with the permission of the Commissioner General and   subject to any conditions he may impose, packages containing sulphuric acid may be discharged overside into boats, lighters, or other craft, for conveyance to an approved place of unloading or to a magazine.

type.name: section
type.title: Temporary storage.
type.context: SULPHURIC ACID ACT under Temporary storage. 5. The owner of any approved place of unloading at which sulphuric  acid  is  landed  shall  provide  on  that  place  for  the temporary storage thereof a suitable store-room, constructed and secured to the satisfaction of the Commissioner, and all sulphuric acid landed at that place shall be placed in that store-room within twelve hours of landing, unless removed from that place under this Act LAWS OF GUYANA Sulphuric Acid Cap. 92:02 5  L.R.O. 1/2012              Magazines for storage.                Permit for removal.    Schedule.             Regulations.     Penalty.  within that period.
type.description: The owner of any approved place of unloading at which sulphuric  acid  is  landed  shall  provide  on  that  place  for  the temporary storage thereof a suitable store-room, constructed and secured to the satisfaction of the Commissioner, and all sulphuric acid landed at that place shall be placed in that store-room within twelve hours of landing, unless removed from that place under this Act LAWS OF GUYANA Sulphuric Acid Cap. 92:02 5  L.R.O. 1/2012              Magazines for storage.                Permit for removal.    Schedule.             Regulations.     Penalty.  within that period.

type.name: section
type.title: Magazines for storage.
type.context: SULPHURIC ACID ACT under Magazines for storage. 6.(1) No  quantity  of  sulphuric  acid  exceeding  twenty gallons shall be kept at any one place by any person except in a magazine duly certified in writing by the Commissioner as a fit and proper  place for the storage of the acid.  (2) The magazine shall be used exclusively for the storage of sulphuric acid and of the receptacles, tools, and instruments used in connection therewith.

description.description: No  quantity  of  sulphuric  acid  exceeding  twenty gallons shall be kept at any one place by any person except in a magazine duly certified in writing by the Commissioner as a fit and proper  place for the storage of the acid.
The magazine shall be used exclusively for the storage of sulphuric acid and of the receptacles, tools, and instruments used in connection therewith.

type.name: section
type.title: Permit for removal.
type.context: SULPHURIC ACID ACT under Permit for removal. 7.  No quantity of sulphuric acid exceeding one gallon shall be removed from any premises without a written permit in that behalf granted by a superintendent of police to any person, being apparently above the age of eighteen years, on the application in writing, in the form in the Schedule of someone having an interest in the removal:  Provided that no permit shall be required for the removal of sulphuric acid from any magazine on a sugar estate for use at a factory on the same estate.
type.description: No quantity of sulphuric acid exceeding one gallon shall be removed from any premises without a written permit in that behalf granted by a superintendent of police to any person, being apparently above the age of eighteen years, on the application in writing, in the form in the Schedule of someone having an interest in the removal:  Provided that no permit shall be required for the removal of sulphuric acid from any magazine on a sugar estate for use at a factory on the same estate.

type.name: section
type.title: Regulations.
type.context: SULPHURIC ACID ACT under Regulations. 8. The Minister may make regulations for the purpose of carrying this Act into effect.
type.description: The Minister may make regulations for the purpose of carrying this Act into effect.

type.name: section
type.title: Penalty. type.context: SULPHURIC ACID ACT under Penalty.  SCHEDULEApplication for permit for removal.   __________________________ 1929 Ed. c. 274 _______________________________________________________ 7 of 1928 An Act to regulate the importation, storage, removal and sale of Sulphuric Acid.   [21st April, 1928]  Short title.      Interpretation. [26 of 1949] c. 82:01       9. Anyone who acts in contravention of, or fails to comply with, any of the provisions of this Act or of any regulations made hereunder shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine of three hundred dollars.
